concept.title: MultiRead2: Reading Multiple Resource Files with Cross-referenced Resources

conbody.p: The files reproduced here are the main files contained in the examples directory. Some extra files may be needed to run the examples, and these will be found in the appropriate examples directory.
conbody.section:
Download
Click on the following link to download the example: MultiRead2.zipDownload some additional files required by the example: CommonFramework
Click: browse to view the example code. View the additional files: browse.

section.title: Description
section.p: MultiRead2 shows how to use multiple resource files with cross-referenced resources. It depends on the resource file created for the MultiRead1 and SigCheck projects.

It introduces a second resource file, MultiRead2, which contains an LLINK to a resource defined in the MultiRead1 project. The important point to note is that the effect of introducing this second resource file is minimal: just another #include file; and the logic in doExampleL() would be identical whether the LLINK pointed to another resource in the same file or a different file.

section.title: Class Summary
section.p: TResourceReaderInterprets resource data read from a resource file

section.title: Build Notes
section.p: You must have built MultiRead1 and SigCheck beforehand.
